issue.title: Visit inside InlineQueryRootExpression in nav expansion

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: [release/8.0] Visit inside InlineQueryRootExpression in nav expansion

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32331, backports #32460.

### Description

As part of the primitive collection work for EF 8, the new InlineCollectionQueryRoot expression type was introduced to represent collections which are inline in the LINQ query (e.g. `Where(b => new[] { 1, 3 }.Where(...)`). However, our navigation expansion visitor, which is responsible for processing navigations, was not modified to visit inside this new expression type; as a result, navigations inside subqueries within InlineCollectionQueryRoot do not work.

### Customer impact

Queries which include navigations inside an inline collection fail to execute, e.g.:

```c#
_ = context.Blogs
    .Select(b => new[] { b.Updated, b.Posts.Max(p => p.Updated) }.Max())
    .ToList();
```

Such queries used to work in 7.0, if the code in question was in the top-level Select (and got client-evaluated).

### How found

Customers reported on 8.0

### Regression

Yes

### Testing

Added.

### Risk

Low - very targeted and single, simple fix (but in the query pipeline, which is never zero-risk). Quirk added.

issue.title: [release/8.0] Cosmos: Generate ordinal values for key properties that used not to be persisted.

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Port of #32469
Fixes #32363
Fixes #32410

### Description

We fixed #31664 for 8.0 RTM. It was a known breaking change, but had bigger impact then initially thought for existing databases. With that fix the nested entities fail to load when queried as the now required key value is missing. The new fix is to use a generated ordinal value in this case (this is the same value that the property would have had in 8.0.0-rc2 and previous versions).

### Customer impact

Users with an existing database that use a model with nested owned collections where the entity type has an `int` property that matches our key convention (e.g. named `Id`) are either getting an exception during query execution or the nested collection is silently lost.

### How found

Customers reported on 8.0

### Regression

Yes

### Testing

Added.

### Risk

Low, reverses some of the behavior changed in a previous fix. Added a quirk for this fix and also for #31664 in case there are more scenarios not covered by the current fix.
